org.wikipedia.miner.model
Class Page

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.model.Page
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Article, Category, Redirect, SensePage
public abstract class Page
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

This class provides properties and methods that are relevant for all pages in Wikipedia. It may relate to an article, a redirect to an article, a disambiguation page or a category. The type of a page can be examined so that an instance of the appropriate sub-class can be obtained for additional functionality: e.g. if (page.getType == Page.ARTICLE) Article art = (Article)page ;

Author:
David Milne

Constructor Detail

Page

public Page(WikipediaDatabase database,
            int id,
            java.lang.String title,
            int type)
Initialises a newly created Page so that it represents the page given by id, title and type. This is the most efficient page constructor as no database lookup is required.

Parameters:
database - an active WikipediaDatabase
id - the unique identifier of the page
title - the (case dependent) title of the page
type - the type of the page (ARTICLE, CATEGORY, REDIRECT or DISAMBIGUATION_PAGE)

Page

public Page(WikipediaDatabase database,
            int id)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
Initialises a newly created Page so that it represents the page given by id.

Parameters:
database - an active WikipediaDatabase
id - the unique identifier of the Wikipedia page
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

Page

public Page(WikipediaDatabase database,
            java.lang.String title,
            int type)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
Initialises a newly created Page so that it represents the page given by title and type.

Parameters:
database - an active WikipediaDatabase
title - the (case sensitive) title of the page.
type - the type of the page (ARTICLE, CATEGORY, REDIRECT or DISAMBIGUATION_PAGE)
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if no page is defined for the given title and type

compareTo

public int compareTo(Page p)
Compares this page to another. If weights are defined for both pages, then the page with the larger weight will be considered smaller (and thus appear earlier in sorted lists). Otherwise, the comparison is made based on their unique identifiers.

Parameters:
p - the Page to be compared
Returns:
see above.

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Compares this Page to another Object. If the Object is a descendant of Page, this function behaves like compareTo(Page). Otherwise, it throws a ClassCastSQLException (as Pages are comparable only to other Pages).

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
Parameters:
o - the Object to be compared
Returns:
see above
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException

                     throws java.sql.SQLException

the generality of the page
Throws:

getContent

public java.lang.String getContent()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the content of the page, marked up in raw media wiki form. You can then use Markup stripper to get the parts you are interested in.

Returns:
content of the page, in raw media wiki format.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if page content has not been stored in the database.

getFirstSentence

public java.lang.String getFirstSentence()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the first sentence from the content of this page, cleaned of all markup and formatting. This generally serves as a definition of the concept or concepts for which this article, disambiguation page or category was written.

Returns:
the first sentence on this page.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if page content has not been imported, or if there is another problem with the wikipedia database

getFirstParagraph

public java.lang.String getFirstParagraph()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the first paragraph from the content of this page, cleaned of all markup and formatting. This generally serves as a more specific definition of the concept or concepts for which this article, disambiguation page or category was written.

Returns:
the first paragraph on this page.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if page content has not been imported, or if there is another problem with the wikipedia database

getTitleWithoutScope

public java.lang.String getTitleWithoutScope()
Returns the title without the text used to differentiate between ambiguous terms. e.g. returns Plane for both Plane (mathematics) and Plane (vehicle)

Returns:
the title without scope text

getScope

public java.lang.String getScope()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the text found within parenthesis in the title. This typically indicates scope; to differentiate an ambiguous title: e.g. Plane (mathematics) v.s. Plane (vehicle).

Returns:
the parenthesisText, or null if none is found.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Provides a demo of functionality available to Pages

Parameters:
args - an array of arguments for connecting to a wikipedia datatabase: server and database names at a minimum, and optionally a username and password
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database.
